definitions.text: something left after other parts have been taken away
examples: there was no remainder
he threw away the rest
he took what he wanted and I got the balance

definitions.text: freedom from activity (work or strain or responsibility)
examples: took his repose by the swimming pool
people actually accomplish more when they take time for short rests
a body will continue in a state of rest until acted upon

definitions.text: euphemisms for death (based on an analogy between lying in a bed and in a tomb)
examples: she was laid to rest beside her husband
they had to put their family pet to sleep

definitions.text: a support on which things can be put
examples: the gun was steadied on a special rest

definitions.text: a musical notation indicating a silence of a specified duration
not move; be in a resting position
take a short break from one's activities in order to relax

examples: He rested his bad leg
Rest the dogs for a moment

definitions.text: have a place in relation to something else
examples: The fate of Bosnia lies in the hands of the West
The responsibility rests with the Allies

definitions.text: stay the same; remain in a certain state
examples: The dress remained wet after repeated attempts to dry it
rest assured
stay alone
He remained unmoved by her tears
The bad weather continued for another week

definitions.text: put something in a resting position, as for support or steadying
examples: Rest your head on my shoulder
The birds perched high in the tree

definitions.text: rest on or as if on a pillow
examples: pillow your head
The committee is resting over the summer
